parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To glorify, honor, bestow glory on. From doxa; to render glorious.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.
Probably from the base of harpazo; fruit, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.
